newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan parliament may appoint PM on Nov 7 - spokesman.
newsitem.headline: Japan parliament may appoint PM on Nov 7 - spokesman.

text.p: Chief Cabinet Secretary Seiroku Kajiyama said on Tuesday that a special session of parliament to appoint the prime minister following last Sunday's general election may be held around November 7.
Kajiyama told a news conference that parliamentary officials said 10 days to two weeks were needed to prepare for the special session.
"Time is also needed for consultations among parties as the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) failed to win a majority in the Lower House of parliament," he said.

On Monday, Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto, who is also president of the LDP, agreed with his party's two partners in the outgoing coalition government to start talks on Tuesday about forming a new coalition. The LDP's two partners are the Social Democratic Party and Sakigake.
